org.numenta.nupic.encoders

Class MultiEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.encoders.Encoder<java.lang.Object>
      • org.numenta.nupic.encoders.MultiEncoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Persistable

    public class MultiEncoder
extends Encoder<java.lang.Object>
    A MultiEncoder encodes a dictionary or object with multiple components. A MultiEncode contains a number of sub-encoders, each of which encodes a separate component.
    Author:
    wlmiller
    See Also:
    Encoder, Encoding, Parameters, Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MultiEncoder.Builder
      Returns a EncoderBuilder for constructing MultiEncoders The base class architecture is put together in such a way where boilerplate initialization can be kept to a minimum for implementing subclasses, while avoiding the mistake-proneness of extremely long argument lists.

      • setFieldStats

        public void setFieldStats(java.lang.String fieldName,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> fieldStatistics)
        Description copied from class: Encoder
        This method is called by the model to set the statistics like min and max for the underlying encoders if this information is available.
        Overrides:
        setFieldStats in class Encoder<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        fieldName - fieldName name of the field this encoder is encoding, provided by MultiEncoder
        fieldStatistics - fieldStatistics dictionary of dictionaries with the first level being the fieldName and the second index the statistic ie: fieldStatistics['pounds']['min']

      • encodeIntoArray

        public void encodeIntoArray(java.lang.Object input,
                            int[] output)
        Encodes inputData and puts the encoded value into the output array, which is a 1-D array of length returned by Encoder.getW(). Note: The output array is reused, so clear it before updating it.
        Specified by:
        encodeIntoArray in class Encoder<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        input - Data to encode. This should be validated by the encoder.
        output - 1-D array of same length returned by Encoder.getW()

      • getBucketValues

        public <S> java.util.List<S> getBucketValues(java.lang.Class<S> returnType)
        Description copied from class: Encoder
        Returns a list of items, one for each bucket defined by this encoder. Each item is the value assigned to that bucket, this is the same as the EncoderResult.value that would be returned by getBucketInfo() for that bucket and is in the same format as the input that would be passed to encode(). This call is faster than calling getBucketInfo() on each bucket individually if all you need are the bucket values.
        Specified by:
        getBucketValues in class Encoder<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        returnType - class type parameter so that this method can return encoder specific value types
        Returns:
        list of items, each item representing the bucket value for that bucket.
